column4: it would appear that you don't have a network cable correctly connected
do you have a network cable connected, or are you trying to use wireless?
it is wireless, and my router is connected... i can use it on windows..
ahhhhhh, wireless. what version of ubuntu are you using?
ok, click on the network icon, and tell me if your wireless network is listed there
is it showing as connected, or just available?
is your wireless net configured for some level of wep or wpa encription?
I would start off by removing all encription on the network if you can. then test to make sure you can connect.
once you can connect readd WPA2 encription.
be warned earlier versions of the wireless stack did have issues with WPA.
also make sure you use WPA and not WEP. WEP is very easy to crack
iirc there were also issues with some devices that could operate in "WPA/WPA2" mode. you should always use either "WPA" or "WPA2" with wpa2 being the preference
